remarks: Deduce right inverse from left inverse and left identity in an associative structure (such as a group).  (Contributed by NM, 10-Aug-2013.)  (Proof shortened by Mario Carneiro, 6-Jan-2015.)
statement:
grprinvlem.c $e |- ( ( ph /\ x e. B /\ y e. B ) -> ( x .+ y ) e. B ) $.
grprinvlem.o $e |- ( ph -> O e. B ) $.
grprinvlem.i $e |- ( ( ph /\ x e. B ) -> ( O .+ x ) = x ) $.
grprinvlem.a $e |- ( ( ph /\ ( x e. B /\ y e. B /\ z e. B ) ) -> ( ( x .+ y ) .+ z ) = ( x .+ ( y .+ z ) ) ) $.
grprinvlem.n $e |- ( ( ph /\ x e. B ) -> E. y e. B ( y .+ x ) = O ) $.
grprinvd.x $e |- ( ( ph /\ ps ) -> X e. B ) $.
grprinvd.n $e |- ( ( ph /\ ps ) -> N e. B ) $.
grprinvd.e $e |- ( ( ph /\ ps ) -> ( N .+ X ) = O ) $.
grprinvd $p |- ( ( ph /\ ps ) -> ( X .+ N ) = O ) $.
$d .+ x y z $.
$d B x y z $.
$d N y z $.
$d O x y z $.
$d X y z $.
$d ph x y z $.
$d ps y $.
